page.title: 06HOUSES NEW AND OLD
page.content: On 25th June 1985 Lindsay, Faye and Esther went with Mr Pearson in the car to see the types of houses in our block, and when they were built. we had 12km squares in our block to look at. The oldest house which we saw was a farmhouse which was made from stone. It is about 150 years old.We went down a bummpy road and saw a pair of two storey rubble stone houses with a pantile roof.They were probably built in the late eighteenth century. In Rowlands Gill we saw some terraced houses built for the mining community at the turn of the century.We also saw some bunglows for the miners which were built in 1923.These houses were built for retired miners by the owner of the mine.
